message.content:
cs.CV, cs.SD, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.MM

This paper deals with the problem of synthesizing 3D facial motion from speech, which involves computer vision (CV) techniques such as facial landmark detection and 3D shape modeling. The proposed method also uses deep learning (LG) models to learn non-linear representations and time-warping techniques. Additionally, the paper uses a publicly available dataset (MM) of in-the-wild speech recordings, and the synthesis of facial motion is relevant to the field of speech recognition (CL) and speech processing (SD).
